title: Titus Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Titus chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Titus Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Titus Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:2, how should aged men behave?
options: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience
questions.correctAnswer: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience
questions.explanation: Titus 2:2 instructs that aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, and in patience.

questions.question: What are aged women encouraged to be according to Titus 2:3?
options: Behaving as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things
questions.correctAnswer: Behaving as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things
questions.explanation: Titus 2:3 says aged women should behave in a way that becometh holiness, avoid false accusations, not be given to much wine, and be teachers of good things.

questions.question: Who are the aged women to teach according to Titus 2:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Young women
questions.explanation: Titus 2:4 states that aged women are to teach the young women.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:5, which of the following is NOT listed as a characteristic young women should have?
questions.correctAnswer: Rebellious
questions.explanation: Titus 2:5 instructs young women to be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, and obedient to their own husbands, so rebellious is not listed.

questions.question: What exhortation is given to young men in Titus 2:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Be sober minded
questions.explanation: Titus 2:6 exhorts young men to be sober minded.

questions.question: In Titus 2:7, how is one supposed to show oneself in all things?
options: As a pattern of good works
questions.correctAnswer: As a pattern of good works
questions.explanation: Titus 2:7 instructs to be a pattern of good works in all things.

questions.question: What kind of speech should be shown according to Titus 2:8?
options: Sound speech that cannot be condemned
questions.correctAnswer: Sound speech that cannot be condemned
questions.explanation: Titus 2:8 says to show sound speech that cannot be condemned.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:9, how should servants behave towards their masters?
options: Obedient and pleasing in all things
questions.correctAnswer: Obedient and pleasing in all things
questions.explanation: Titus 2:9 instructs servants to be obedient to their masters and to please them well in all things.

questions.question: What behavior is forbidden for servants in Titus 2:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Purloining
questions.explanation: Titus 2:10 forbids purloining and encourages showing all good fidelity.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:11, what has appeared to all men?
options: The grace of God that bringeth salvation
questions.correctAnswer: The grace of God that bringeth salvation
questions.explanation: Titus 2:11 states that the grace of God bringing salvation has appeared to all men.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 2:12 teaches that we should deny ungodliness and worldly lusts.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Titus 2:12 teaches that we should deny ungodliness and worldly lusts and live soberly, righteously, and godly.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 2:13 speaks about looking for the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Titus 2:13 mentions looking for the blessed hope and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 2:14 says Jesus Christ redeemed us so that we might live in sin.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Titus 2:14 says Jesus gave himself to redeem us from all iniquity and purify us for good works, not sin.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Titus 2:1: 'But speak thou the things which become ______ doctrine:'
questions.correctAnswer: sound
questions.explanation: Titus 2:1 instructs to speak the things which become sound doctrine.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:15, what should no man do to the person who speaks, exhorts, and rebukes with all authority?
questions.correctAnswer: Despise him
questions.explanation: Titus 2:15 commands that no man despise the one who speaks, exhorts, and rebukes with all authority.

medium.title: Titus Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Titus Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: According to Titus 2, how should aged men conduct themselves to reflect sound doctrine?
options: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, and patience
Zealous, loud, and argumentative in faith
questions.correctAnswer: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, and patience
questions.explanation: Titus 2:2 instructs aged men to be sober, grave, temperate, and sound in faith, charity, and patience, showing how their behavior should reflect sound doctrine.

questions.question: What qualities are aged women encouraged to exhibit according to Titus 2?
options: Holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things
Focused only on their own needs
questions.correctAnswer: Holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things
questions.explanation: Titus 2:3 describes that aged women should behave in a way that befits holiness, avoiding false accusations and drunkenness, and be teachers of good things.

questions.question: How does Titus 2 suggest young women should live to honor God’s word?
options: Be sober, love their husbands and children, be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, and obedient
Be silent and withdrawn from community
Challenge their husbands openly in public
questions.correctAnswer: Be sober, love their husbands and children, be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, and obedient
questions.explanation: Titus 2:4-5 outlines that young women should be sober, love their husbands and children, be discreet, chaste, good homemakers, and obedient to their husbands so that God's word is not blasphemed.

questions.question: What advice does Titus 2 give concerning young men’s behavior?
options: Encourage to be bold and rash
Urge them to seek worldly pleasures
questions.correctAnswer: Exhort to be sober minded
questions.explanation: Titus 2:6 instructs that young men should be exhorted to be sober minded, reflecting self-control and maturity.

questions.question: In what way is a Christian leader encouraged to live according to Titus 2?
options: Showself a pattern of good works, uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity, and sound speech
questions.correctAnswer: Showself a pattern of good works, uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity, and sound speech
questions.explanation: Titus 2:7-8 encourages leaders to exhibit good works, integrity, seriousness, sincerity, and speech that cannot be condemned, so that opponents have nothing evil to say.

questions.question: What instructions are given to servants about their work ethic in Titus 2?
options: Be obedient, please their masters well, do not answer back, and show all good fidelity
questions.correctAnswer: Be obedient, please their masters well, do not answer back, and show all good fidelity
questions.explanation: Titus 2:9-10 advises servants to obey their masters, please them in all things without responding back, and show faithfulness to adorn the doctrine of God.

questions.question: What has the grace of God appeared to bring according to Titus 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation to all men
questions.explanation: Titus 2:11 states that the grace of God bringing salvation has appeared to all men, emphasizing the universal offer of salvation.

questions.question: What lifestyle does Titus 2 teach believers to live as a result of God’s grace?
options: Deny ungodliness and worldly lusts; live soberly, righteously, and godly
questions.correctAnswer: Deny ungodliness and worldly lusts; live soberly, righteously, and godly
questions.explanation: Titus 2:12 teaches that God's grace instructs believers to reject ungodliness and worldly desires, living soberly, righteously, and godly in the present world.

questions.question: What hope are believers encouraged to look for in Titus 2?
options: The blessed hope and glorious appearing of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The blessed hope and glorious appearing of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Titus 2:13 encourages believers to look forward to the blessed hope—the glorious appearing of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Why did Jesus give Himself according to Titus 2?
options: To redeem us from all iniquity and purify a peculiar people zealous of good works
To gain wealth for His followers
questions.correctAnswer: To redeem us from all iniquity and purify a peculiar people zealous of good works
questions.explanation: Titus 2:14 explains that Jesus gave Himself to redeem us from sin and purify a special people zealous for good works.

questions.question: How does Titus 2 instruct believers to communicate teachings and corrections?
options: Speak, exhort, and rebuke with all authority so no one despises you
questions.correctAnswer: Speak, exhort, and rebuke with all authority so no one despises you
questions.explanation: Titus 2:15 commands that teachings and rebukes be delivered with full authority, ensuring respect and effectiveness in ministry.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 2 teaches that the grace of God instructs believers to live righteously and godly in this present world.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Titus 2:12 clearly states that the grace of God teaches us to live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present world.

questions.question: True or False: According to Titus 2, servants are encouraged to purloin from their masters to gain favor.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Titus 2:10 instructs servants not to steal but to show good fidelity, so they adorn the doctrine of God our Savior.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Titus 2 teaches that young women should be sober, love their husbands and children, be discreet, chaste, ________, good, and obedient to their own husbands.
questions.correctAnswer: keepers at home
questions.explanation: Titus 2:5 instructs young women to be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, and obedient to their husbands.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with impatience and discouragement. Based on Titus 2, what biblical truth would you share to encourage patience and godly living?
options: The aged should be sound in patience and charity, setting an example in faith and good works
Ignore the struggle and hope it resolves
Focus on worldly success to feel better
questions.correctAnswer: The aged should be sound in patience and charity, setting an example in faith and good works
questions.explanation: Titus 2:2 and 2:7-8 emphasize patience, charity, and setting a godly example through sound faith and good works as encouragement for believers facing trials.

hard.title: Titus Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Titus Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:2, what qualities should aged men exhibit?
options: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, patience
questions.correctAnswer: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, patience
questions.explanation: Titus 2:2 explicitly lists these qualities as characteristics that become aged men, emphasizing sober-mindedness and sound faith.

questions.question: The role of aged women in Titus 2:3-4 includes which of the following tasks?
options: Teaching young women to be sober and love their husbands and children
questions.correctAnswer: Teaching young women to be sober and love their husbands and children
questions.explanation: Titus 2:3-4 clearly states that aged women are to teach young women to be sober and to love their husbands and children, focusing on mentorship and holiness.

questions.question: In Titus 2:5, which behavior is NOT listed as an expectation for young women?
questions.correctAnswer: Dominant in household decisions
questions.explanation: Titus 2:5 emphasizes obedience and modesty for young women, with no mention of dominance in household decisions, reflecting cultural norms of the time.

questions.question: What exhortation is given to young men in Titus 2:6?
questions.correctAnswer: To be sober minded
questions.explanation: Titus 2:6 explicitly exhorts young men to be sober minded, indicating self-control and seriousness as virtues for them.

questions.question: Which literary device is evident in Titus 2:7-8 where Paul encourages Timothy to show himself as a pattern of good works and sound speech?
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm
questions.explanation: Titus 2:7-8 uses a chiasm structure highlighting behavior (pattern of good works) and speech (sound speech) to emphasize integrity and example.

questions.question: How does the instruction for servants in Titus 2:9-10 reflect the social and cultural context of the ancient Near East?
options: Servants are told to be obedient, not to answer back, and to show good fidelity
Servants are encouraged to seek freedom by revolt
Servants are instructed to become masters themselves
Servants are to ignore their masters' commands
questions.correctAnswer: Servants are told to be obedient, not to answer back, and to show good fidelity
questions.explanation: Titus 2:9-10 reflects the hierarchical social order of the time, emphasizing obedience and integrity to maintain the reputation of the gospel.

questions.question: The appearance of God's grace bringing salvation to all men in Titus 2:11 is a clear allusion to which Old Testament theme?
options: The universal covenant blessings promised to Abraham
The anointing of kings in Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The universal covenant blessings promised to Abraham
questions.explanation: Titus 2:11’s universal offer of salvation echoes the Abrahamic covenant’s promise that all nations would be blessed through Abraham’s seed (Genesis 12:3).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Titus 2:12 teaches that the grace of God instructs us to deny _____ and worldly lusts.
questions.correctAnswer: ungodliness
questions.explanation: Titus 2:12 specifically states denying ungodliness and worldly lusts as part of living soberly and righteously.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:13, what are believers looking forward to?
options: The blessed hope and glorious appearing of Jesus Christ
The coming of the Messiah in the Old Testament era
questions.correctAnswer: The blessed hope and glorious appearing of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Titus 2:13 explicitly mentions the blessed hope and the glorious appearing of the great God and Savior Jesus Christ as the future hope for believers.

questions.question: Which theological concept is foreshadowed in Titus 2:14 by the mention of Christ redeeming us from all iniquity?
options: The doctrine of sanctification and redemption
The sacrificial system of the Old Testament
The Mosaic Law as a covenant
questions.correctAnswer: The doctrine of sanctification and redemption
questions.explanation: Titus 2:14 speaks of Christ's redemptive work and purification of a peculiar people, pointing forward to sanctification and redemption themes central to New Testament theology.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 2:15 instructs Timothy to speak, exhort, and rebuke with all authority and to allow others to despise him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Titus 2:15 commands Timothy to speak and rebuke with authority and explicitly states that no one should despise him, highlighting the importance of authoritative teaching.

questions.question: In the Greek text of Titus 2:7, the word translated as 'uncorruptness' (ἀμίαντος, amiantos) implies what about Timothy’s teaching?
options: It should be blameless and free from moral defilement
It should be secretive and hidden
It should be flexible and adaptable
It should be humorous and lighthearted
questions.correctAnswer: It should be blameless and free from moral defilement
questions.explanation: The Greek term ἀμίαντος (amiantos) in Titus 2:7 conveys the idea of being 'unblemished' or blameless, emphasizing purity in doctrine.

questions.question: What is the significance of the term 'peculiar people' (Titus 2:14) in the cultural and historical context of the New Testament?
options: It signifies a people set apart for God, echoing the Old Testament concept of Israel as God's chosen people
It refers to a secret society
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies a people set apart for God, echoing the Old Testament concept of Israel as God's chosen people
questions.explanation: The phrase 'peculiar people' in Titus 2:14 echoes Old Testament language (e.g., Exodus 19:5) describing God's covenant people as set apart for His purposes.

questions.question: Which cross-biblical connection is illustrated by the exhortation in Titus 2:9-10 for servants to adorn the doctrine of God our Savior?
options: It parallels Jesus’ teaching on servant leadership in the Gospels
It echoes the Levitical laws on purity
It imitates the Psalms of David
questions.correctAnswer: It parallels Jesus’ teaching on servant leadership in the Gospels
questions.explanation: The call for servants to adorn the doctrine by good conduct in Titus 2:9-10 parallels Jesus’ model of servant leadership as seen in passages like Mark 10:42-45.

questions.question: What phrase in Titus 2:8 serves as a literary device to emphasize the integrity of Timothy's teaching and conduct?
options: Sound speech that cannot be condemned
Faithful in little, faithful in much
Eye for an eye, tooth for a tooth
questions.correctAnswer: Sound speech that cannot be condemned
questions.explanation: The phrase 'sound speech that cannot be condemned' in Titus 2:8 uses parallelism to emphasize the impeccable quality of Timothy’s teaching and behavior.

theological.title: Titus Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Titus Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:2, what qualities should characterize aged men in sound doctrine?
options: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, patience
questions.correctAnswer: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, patience
questions.explanation: Titus 2:2 specifically calls for aged men to be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, and patience. These qualities reflect a mature Christian character consistent with Proverbs 16:31 (gray hair is a crown of glory), 1 Timothy 3:2-3 (qualifications for elders), James 5:7 (patience), Galatians 5:22-23 (fruit of the Spirit), and 2 Timothy 2:24.

questions.question: What behavior is exhorted for aged women according to Titus 2:3?
options: Behaving in holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things
Bold speakers, eager to debate, generous with resources, leaders in worship
Quiet, submissive, isolated, uninterested in teaching
questions.correctAnswer: Behaving in holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things
questions.explanation: Titus 2:3 emphasizes that aged women should behave in holiness, avoid false accusations, refrain from excessive wine, and be teachers of good things. This aligns with Proverbs 31:26 (she opens her mouth with wisdom), 1 Timothy 5:9-10 (reputation of older women), Ephesians 5:3-4 (holiness), and Proverbs 20:1 (warning against wine).

questions.question: What are young women instructed to love according to Titus 2:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Their husbands and their children
questions.explanation: Titus 2:4 teaches young women to love their husbands and children, reflecting the biblical ideal of familial love and care as seen in Ephesians 5:22-33 (wives and husbands), Proverbs 31:27 (caring for household), 1 Timothy 5:14, and Colossians 3:18-21.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:5, what is one reason young women should be obedient to their own husbands?
options: So that the word of God be not blasphemed
questions.correctAnswer: So that the word of God be not blasphemed
questions.explanation: Titus 2:5 connects obedience of young women to their husbands with the preservation of God's word from blasphemy. This principle highlights the witness of Christian conduct, consistent with 1 Peter 3:1-2, Colossians 3:18, Ephesians 5:22-24, and Proverbs 31:11.

questions.question: What exhortation is given to young men in Titus 2:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Be sober minded
questions.explanation: Titus 2:6 exhorts young men to be sober minded, indicating self-control and sound judgment, which is consistent with 1 Timothy 4:12, 1 Peter 1:13, Proverbs 3:21, and Philippians 4:5.

questions.question: How should one show themselves according to Titus 2:7 in all things?
options: A pattern of good works with uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity in doctrine
A leader in debate and argument
questions.correctAnswer: A pattern of good works with uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity in doctrine
questions.explanation: Titus 2:7 calls for a pattern of good works and integrity in doctrine, reflecting Christlike character. This is supported by Matthew 5:16 (good works glorify God), James 2:18, 1 Timothy 4:12, and Philippians 2:15.

questions.question: What kind of speech should Christians exhibit according to Titus 2:8?
options: Sound speech that cannot be condemned
questions.correctAnswer: Sound speech that cannot be condemned
questions.explanation: Titus 2:8 emphasizes speech that is wholesome and blameless to avoid giving opponents grounds for criticism, consistent with Ephesians 4:29, Colossians 4:6, Proverbs 15:1, and James 1:26.

questions.question: According to Titus 2:9-10, how should servants behave toward their masters?
options: Obedient, pleasing in all things, not answering back, not purloining, showing good fidelity
Silent and fearful, hiding their true feelings
Indifferent and aloof, ignoring their duties
questions.correctAnswer: Obedient, pleasing in all things, not answering back, not purloining, showing good fidelity
questions.explanation: Titus 2:9-10 instructs servants to obey their masters fully, avoid theft, and demonstrate faithfulness, so that God's doctrine is honored. This aligns with Ephesians 6:5-8, Colossians 3:22-25, 1 Peter 2:18, and Proverbs 22:29.

questions.question: What has appeared to all men according to Titus 2:11?
options: The grace of God that bringeth salvation
questions.correctAnswer: The grace of God that bringeth salvation
questions.explanation: Titus 2:11 reveals that God’s saving grace has appeared to all humanity, a core Christian doctrine about salvation by grace. This is consistent with John 1:14-17, Romans 3:24, Ephesians 2:8-9, and 2 Corinthians 12:9.

questions.question: What does the grace of God teach us according to Titus 2:12?
options: To deny ungodliness and worldly lusts and to live soberly, righteously, and godly
questions.correctAnswer: To deny ungodliness and worldly lusts and to live soberly, righteously, and godly
questions.explanation: Titus 2:12 explains that grace instructs believers to reject sin and live godly lives, reflecting teachings in Romans 6:12-14, Galatians 5:16-25, 1 Peter 1:15-16, and Ephesians 4:22-24.

questions.question: What is the blessed hope mentioned in Titus 2:13?
options: The glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ
The coming of the Messiah in the past
questions.correctAnswer: The glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Titus 2:13 speaks of the blessed hope as the future return of Christ, affirming His deity and role as Savior. This eschatological hope is echoed in 1 Thessalonians 4:16-17, Hebrews 9:28, Revelation 1:7, and Philippians 3:20-21.

questions.question: Why did Jesus give Himself for us according to Titus 2:14?
options: To redeem us from all iniquity and purify a peculiar people zealous of good works
questions.correctAnswer: To redeem us from all iniquity and purify a peculiar people zealous of good works
questions.explanation: Titus 2:14 teaches Christ’s redemptive purpose to purify believers for good works, consistent with Isaiah 53:5, Ephesians 1:7, 1 Peter 1:18-19, and Hebrews 9:14.

questions.question: What authority is given to the speaker in Titus 2:15 concerning teaching and exhortation?
options: To speak, exhort, and rebuke with all authority
To speak only gently and avoid rebuke
To allow others to correct them
questions.correctAnswer: To speak, exhort, and rebuke with all authority
questions.explanation: Titus 2:15 commands authoritative teaching and correction to maintain sound doctrine, agreeing with 2 Timothy 4:2, 1 Timothy 5:20, Matthew 18:15, and Jude 1:3.

questions.question: How does Titus 2:15 warn the teacher not to be treated?
questions.correctAnswer: Let no man despise thee
questions.explanation: Titus 2:15 exhorts the teacher to maintain confidence so that no one despises or disregards him, reflecting the principle in 1 Timothy 4:12, 2 Timothy 1:7-8, Proverbs 3:26, and Philippians 1:27.

questions.question: What is the connection between good works and doctrine in Titus 2:10?
options: Good works adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour
Good works replace the need for doctrine
Doctrine is irrelevant to good works
Good works are separate from doctrine
questions.correctAnswer: Good works adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour
questions.explanation: Titus 2:10 teaches that faithful conduct enhances the credibility of Christian teaching, echoing Matthew 5:16, James 2:18, 1 Timothy 4:12, and 1 Peter 2:12.
